trans-unit.source: Modifies the User Interface Privilege Isolation (UIPI) message filter for a specified window

seg-source.mrk: Modifies the User Interface Privilege Isolation (UIPI) message filter for a specified window

target.mrk: Modifies the User Interface Privilege Isolation (UIPI) message filter for a specified window

trans-unit.source: Handle to the window whose UIPI message filter is to be modified.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the window whose UIPI message filter is to be modified.

target.mrk: Handle to the window whose UIPI message filter is to be modified.

trans-unit.source: If this parameter is 0, the UIPI message filter will be modified in a process-wide manner.

seg-source.mrk: If this parameter is 0, the UIPI message filter will be modified in a process-wide manner.

target.mrk: If this parameter is 0, the UIPI message filter will be modified in a process-wide manner.

trans-unit.source: Moreover, under Windows Vista this parameter is not used and should be set to 0.

seg-source.mrk: Moreover, under Windows Vista this parameter is not used and should be set to 0.

target.mrk: Moreover, under Windows Vista this parameter is not used and should be set to 0.

trans-unit.source: The message that the message filter allows through or blocks.

seg-source.mrk: The message that the message filter allows through or blocks.

target.mrk: The message that the message filter allows through or blocks.

trans-unit.source: The action to be performed. This parameter can be one of the following values:

seg-source.mrk: This parameter can be one of the following values:

target.mrk: This parameter can be one of the following values:

trans-unit.source: 1 and sets the @extended flag to 0 or one of the following values (only under Windows 7 or later).

seg-source.mrk: 1 and sets the @extended flag to 0 or one of the following values (only under Windows 7 or later).

target.mrk: 1 and sets the @extended flag to 0 or one of the following values (only under Windows 7 or later).

trans-unit.source: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended code information.

seg-source.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended code information.

target.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended code information.

trans-unit.source: UIPI is a security feature that prevents messages from being received from a lower-integrity-level sender.

seg-source.mrk: UIPI is a security feature that prevents messages from being received from a lower-integrity-level sender.

target.mrk: UIPI is a security feature that prevents messages from being received from a lower-integrity-level sender.

trans-unit.source: You can use this function to allow specific messages to be delivered to a window even if the message originates from a process at a lower integrity level.

seg-source.mrk: You can use this function to allow specific messages to be delivered to a window even if the message originates from a process at a lower integrity level.

target.mrk: You can use this function to allow specific messages to be delivered to a window even if the message originates from a process at a lower integrity level.

trans-unit.source: Certain messages whose value is smaller than WM_USER are required to be passed through the filter, regardless of the filter setting. There will be no effect when you attempt to use this function to allow or block such messages.

seg-source.mrk: Certain messages whose value is smaller than WM_USER are required to be passed through the filter, regardless of the filter setting.
There will be no effect when you attempt to use this function to allow or block such messages.

target.mrk: Certain messages whose value is smaller than WM_USER are required to be passed through the filter, regardless of the filter setting.
There will be no effect when you attempt to use this function to allow or block such messages.

trans-unit.source: This function requires Windows Vista or later.

seg-source.mrk: This function requires Windows Vista or later.

target.mrk: This function requires Windows Vista or later.
